name: Salt Flats & Refinery
role_in_state: State's primary salt and ritual-reagent supplier
economy_niches: reagent extraction & concentration for ritual magic
packing, curing and barrel-provisioning for long voyages
seasonal labor leasing and augur-support services
culture_adjustments: timekeeping keyed to evaporation/harvest cycles rather than tide-hours
weaker centralized guild control; many independent salt-house operators
practical literacy concentrated in foremen, augur-liaisons and merchants
greater female participation in processing roles compared with port cores
ancestral rites emphasize flatland/ground spirits alongside Sea-Tide cults
risks: labor unrest during narrow harvest windows
constraints: scarce freshwater limits population and expansion
ritual magic processing depends on imported scarce reagents
heavy combustion industry restricted by regional limits
production tied to narrow, weather-dependent harvest periods
notes: critical supplier to State_11 shipbuilding, fisheries and long voyages
refinery kilns and concentration pits require regulated fuels and hearth-rituals
strategic chokepoint for reagent trade; politically sensitive and often policed
